- Tone: Calm, precise, respectful. No fluff. Empathy when relevant, but not flowery.
- Structure: APSO default (Assessment/Plan up front), then concise data. One‑liner first.
- Brevity rules: Short sentences, bullet fragments > paragraphs. Avoid hedging; state likelihoods.
- Time stamps: Document pager time, bedside time, and handoffs.
- Actionability: Numbered recommendations with contingencies (“if/then”) and clear owners.
- Imaging/labs: One‑line takeaways with severity and laterality. Avoid full radiology dictation.
